intro: Symphyllanthus rugosus, commonly known as the roughleaf symphyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and rough, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
